channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA

item.title: Report E-2023080724
item.description:
Report E-2023080724

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While loading an outbound trailer of totes at Veolia's 10-day facility in Port Allen, LA a forklift punctured the IBC. The forks of the lift were extending approximately 3-4 inches beyond the underneath of the IBC and while repositioning the tote the fork made contact with another tote behind it, resulting in a ~3" gash at the bottom corner of the container. The tote began leaking rapidly and spilled ~150 gallons within a 10 minute span. The material flooded the back of the box van and the surrounding concrete of the dock area. The Veolia team quickly began blocking off the storm drain located in the dock area with spill pads and oil dry, as well as blocking off the back of the trailer to slow the pace of the material leaking out the trailer. The spill was promptly cleaned up and absorbent material was containerized. The remaining material in the damaged tote was transferred into a new container.

item.title: Report X-2023081120
item.description:
Report X-2023081120

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package was found leaking on pallet by belt line. Manager notified QA about damaged package. Box was placed into a red hazardous tote and moved to hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: Glass bottles had loose caps which caused liquid to spill out into box and bottles. Liquid caused a red stain to spill on bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat package was placed into a red hazardous tote and moved to hazmat cage for inspection. Proper eye and wear gear were used to transport package to cage.

item.title: Report X-2023081508
item.description:
Report X-2023081508

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: LIVONIA
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: I received a call that there was an odor emitting from a residue Butadiene car in Livonia LA. The car was isolated and discovered that the vapor valve was a quarter turn in the open position with the plug less than tool tight. The valve was closed, and the plug properly tightened, and the odor subsided. No further action was taken and the car release back into transportation.
